intro: Boscia foetida subsp. longipedicellata, commonly known as the stink bush, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellowish-green, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. The plant has small, opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated pedicels, which are longer than those of the typical Boscia foetida.
